text: Alexandre do Nascimento (1 March 1925 - 28 September 2024) was an Angolan Cardinal of the Catholic Church. He was the Archbishop of Luanda from 1986 to 2001, and was elevated to the cardinalate in 1983 by Pope John Paul II. He was born in Malanje, Portuguese Angola. On 10 August 1975, Nascimento was appointed the fourth bishop of Malanje by Pope Paul VI. Nascimento was kidnapped by guerrillas during a pastoral visit on 15 October 1982; he was later freed on 16 November of that same year after Pope John Paul II made an appeal for his release. Nascimento became the oldest living member of the College of Cardinals in August 2022, after the death of Jozef Tomko. Nascimento died on 28 September 2024 in Luanda, Angola at the age of 99. ==References== ==Other websites== *Cardinals of the Holy Roman Church *Catholic-Hierarchy *Catholic-Pages Category:1925 births Category:2024 deaths Category:Cardinals of the Roman Catholic Church Category:Roman Catholic bishops Category:Angolan people
title: Alexandre do Nascimento
